phlebotomy.| ICD10 = | ICD9 = | MeshID = D018962 | OPS301 = | OtherCodes = |
HCPCSlevel2 = }} 'Phlebotomy' ("to cut a vein" in Greek) is the process of
making an incision in a vein. It is associated with venipuncture, the practice
of collecting venous blood samples, and bloodletting, the ancient medical
practice. A person who performs phlebotomy is termed a phlebotomist.
